comment: Guaranteed A! Easiest class ever. Grade is only 7 quizzes (takes highest attempt), 2 exams, attendance, and a really easy group powerpoint presentation. Everything is open book. He only teaches evening classes, but it was worth it imo since all the other MGT 3200 professors had okay reviews. The professor is also super friendly and a nice guy!
Pretty easy overall just show up for attendance, only 2 tests, a group project, and a few quizzes. The tests are original but open notes. Overall with minimal effort, you can get a B.
10000/10 recommend, 2 exams, 10 quizzes, NO essays, one easy powerpoint presentation, go class and you will pass.

He is a really cool guy with a great personality. He has a day job and likes video games and anime and is really nice. Gives constructive feedback and teaches you everything you need to know. Sometimes lectures put me to sleep a bit but I was also just exhausted by 9 PM. He might take attendance so don't take him if you want to skip all the time.

He has a thick accent but you will get an A if you come to class and do all of the assignments. Nothing is hard for the class and the tests are open book and open note. There is one easy group project. Take him if you can.

Very friendly professor, makes students feel welcome. Grades are on online quizzes (which he gives retries for) and two tests worth most of your grade. The material on the tests will be covered in class so I never felt like he mislead the class on the material. Gives personal experiences with concepts and practices we covered, which I appreciate.

Hes a good professor. Based on two tests (which are based on lectures/PPTs), Connect quizzes, and a group project. The book wasnt really used, but it was helpful for the quizzes or any clarification needed for concepts within the PowerPoint. The only complaint is that he has a pretty thick accentwhich is fine, but he also speaks pretty quickly.

If you are looking to learn anything do not take him. He is more concerned with you learning names and dates, rather than concepts. The class is based upon two tests which are based on memorization, connect quizzes, attendance, and a very easy group project powerpoint! Lectures also very boring.

Professor Rodriguez is the best! Even though his class was at 8PM, it was worth taking him! 2 tests (worth 60%), connect quizzes, attendance, and a project (just make a PPT). He was really sweet and funny! He is also willing to help you out with your future. Study the PPT and you will be fine. Take him!!!!

Tests come from powerpoints and lectures - you'll need Connect for quizzes, but you won't need to study the textbook at all for the tests. He likes to draw lots of pictures as explanation for concepts, he's pretty funny sometimes, and he's very clear about what he expects from you and what you need to know for exams. Lectures are boring sometimes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: 2 tests make up a total of 60% of your grade. Just read the PowerPoints and you'll be fine. There are quizzes on MH Connect (cost 90$) that make of 10% of your grade. Attendance is required and is 10% of your grade. There is a group presentation which is 20% of your grade (it's not hard, you only need to make a PowerPoint, no papers.) Not much work

Professor Rodriguez is very good at what he does. His class was very entertaining and easy. The quizzes were straight forward and easy. The book was not never used in class, he used ppt which is where he gets his tests' questions from. If you read his ppt notes and pay attention in class, easy A guarantee. No paper for the group project, only a ppt

Probably one of the best teachers ive had at Kennesaw. He doesn't make the class hard, but wants you to legitimately learn something. The tests and quizs are pretty easy if you pay attention. He works for UPS and only teaches part time, which is a shame because i wish i could take him for more classes. Definitely recommend him.

Mr. Rodriguez is a great professor. He has a heavy accent but you have to be ignorant to not understand him. He is a smart man, very personable and his class was very pleasant to take. His tests are easy if you study. I wish Mr. Rodriguez taught more classes!!!
